meanings.definition: A system of church government in which each local congregation is self-governing.
meanings.sent1: In congregationalism, each church makes its own decisions.
meanings.sent2: The essence of congregationalism lies in the independence of each congregation.
meanings.sent3: The congregationalism of the church picnic planning committee led to chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style was like a form of congregationalism, allowing each team member to govern themselves.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of congregationalism is the freedom it gives to individual congregations.

meanings.definition: The principles and practices of a Congregational church.
meanings.sent1: She studied the history of congregationalism in her church.
meanings.sent2: The values of congregationalism promote community involvement.
meanings.sent3: The humor in the play revolved around the quirks of congregationalism.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to congregationalism was like a beacon of light in the community.
meanings.sent5: The spirit of congregationalism was evident in the joint efforts of the church members.
